intro: Eriocaulon acutifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved spikerush, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It typically grows in wetland habitats such as marshes and swamps, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-poor soils. Eriocaulon acutifolium is often found in temperate regions and plays a role in maintaining wetland ecosystems.
